intro: Kerigomnia bilabrata, commonly known as the two-lipped kerigonia, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that feature two distinct lobes, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Kerigomnia bilabrata is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates.
